page.title: 15RELIGION
page.content:
The parish church is St Oswald's in Askrigg, the incumbency being in the gift of Trinity College, Cambridge. The Church has established The Askrigg Foundation to promote Christian work in the community and Askind to foster employment. The Low Mill residential youth centre with its handicapped persons' wing is concrete proof of the Foundation's worth.
The Methodist congregation is large and healthy and there are chapels in both Askrigg and Bainbridge. A strong oecumenical feeling means a lot of shared activities and joint services.
The Society of Friends (Quakers) has a Meeting in Bainbridge, where Quakerism has been prominent since George Fox preached in the area in 1652.
